description: From Middle English pointles, poynteles, poyntlees; equivalent to point +â€Ž -less.

adjectives.description: pointless (comparative more pointless, superlative most pointless)

entries.meaning: Having no point or sharp tip; terminating squarely or in a rounded end.
Having no prominent or important feature, as of an argument, discourse, etc.
examples: The sequel to the film was even more pointless than the original

entries.meaning: Having no purpose; purposeless; unable to effect an aim.
examples: Since the decision has already been made, further discussion seems pointless.
After four matches and four defeats, United remain pointless at the foot of the table.

entries.meaning: (programming, derogatory) Point-free; employing the tacit programming paradigm.
